channel.title: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania
channel.description: And we can't get 1 fucking day where it doesn't rain... anyone else thinks the weather fucking sucks where they live?

item.title: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Newty:

Northern Michigan has the most drastic variances in weather of any state in America!

Northern Michigan, or in the UP?

Most of my family lives in the UP, it’s pretty shitty up there all the time. Winters are rough, summers are hot. But you are right when you said Michigan has drastic changes.

I live in the thumb, pretty shitty here aswell. Rained for the past week, watch it be 90 out this week, and snow next week.

Read full topic
item.source: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania

I live in Seattle.

We have the most number of days with rain in the USA, but I think some of the south eastern states get more inches

The Wanderer:

It’s so humid in the greater Cincinnati area… During football it was 98 degrees outside but with the heat index it felt like 112. Worst. Practice. Ever.

Damn, and I think play in 30 degrees heat is terrible.

@drubrkletern wrote:

Wait… hold up… I’m the only one who lives in California!!!

OT

I hate the weather, its usually always clear skies and hot, i wish it snowed for once, and rained alot, windy weather and freezing temperatures… that would be awesome :), i absolutely love the cold.

item.title: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:395229”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=492416.msg3600421#msg3600421 date=1305501938]
At least your weather is consistent. Come to southwest Ohio and see how bi-polar weather can really be.
[/quote]
I live in southwest Ohio as well, it’s been raining here mostly every day also. We had a few really hot days last week, but it even rained a little during them.[/quote]
I live 5 mins from southwest Ohio and it has also been raining a lot. There’s a bridge to my school and it almost got to the point where air would be trapped underneath of it and the bridge would separate from the road. Of course it didn’t. I just have one question, how is the Ohio River not terribly high when down in Mississippi it is worse than the '37 flood? I mean, hell, the '97 flood was worse than this one, yet on the Mississippi River they are breaking records.

Read full topic

item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Slave Scyth:

At least your weather is consistent. Come to southwest Ohio and see how bi-polar weather can really be.

Ours is about the same… It’ll be clear and beautiful, and then 2 or 3 hours later it will be storming like hell, and that will last long enough to make it humid as fuck, and soak everything, then be clear again…

item.title: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

Us in Florida have all right to complain. I mean most of the time its way to damn hot…then when it starts to get nice a cold everything we enjoy doing is full by people who aren’t from Florida, cause they say its to cold up north>.>

I enjoy rain I wish there was more of it here, at least its almost hurricane season so we can get more and more rain.

Read full topic

a muddy airsoft war? sounds amazing :D! ahaha

item.title: Hi, I live in Western Pennsylvania
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Slave Scyth:

Yeah, if you live in Florida you’re not allowed to complain about your weather. xD

What about Mississippi then? Lol, I used to live in Michigan and had to drive with all of that snow and ice in winter. I definitely prefer the hot weather here over the ice during winter. Came down here in early Jan so it was chilly out for the locals, while they had on coats and such, I had on pants and a sleeveless lmfao.

Read full topic
